text: “To the people who look at the stars and wish, Rhys.” Rhys clinked his glass against mine. “To the stars who listen— and the dreams that are answered.”
author: Sarah J. Maas

text: What is a person, if not the marks they leave behind?
author: V.E. Schwab

text: It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.
author: Jane Austen

text: I can never read all the books I want; I can never be all the people I want and live all the lives I want. I can never train myself in all the skills I want. And why do I want? I want to live and feel all the shades, tones and variations of mental and physical experience possible in my life. And I am horribly limited.
author: Sylvia Plath

text: It felt like the world had divided into two different types of people, those who had felt pain and those who had yet to feel it. I was in the first group, and I was terrified of the second.
author: Michelle Zauner

text: I could recognize him by touch alone, by smell; I would know him blind, by the way his breaths came and his feet struck the earth. I would know him in death, at the end of the world.
author: Madeline Miller

text: I embrace the label of bad feminist because I am human. I am messy. I’m not trying to be an example. I am not trying to be perfect. I am not trying to say I have all the answers. I am not trying to say I’m right. I am just trying - trying to support what I believe in, trying to do some good in this world, trying to make some noise with my writing while also being myself.
author: Roxanne Gay

text: I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship.
author: Louisa May Alcott

text: Love is or it ain't. Thin love ain't love at all.
author: Toni Morrison

text: It is a common saying that women are delicate creatures, flowers, eggs, anything that may be crushed in a moment's carelessness. If I had ever believed it, I no longer did.
author: Madeline Miller

text: What's the point of having a voice if you're gonna be silent in those moments you shouldn't be?
author: Angie Thomas

text: Courage does not always roar. Valor does not always shine.
author: Tomi Adeyemi

text: Nearly everything I know about love, I've learnt from my long-term friendships with women.
author: Dolly Alderton

text: To feel joyful about love, you have to feel that you’ve opted into it, not that you’ve been forced to participate in it through your decision to be born.
author: Blythe Roberson

text: He's more myself than I am. Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same.
author: Emily Brontë
